alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 4:52AM EDT until June 14 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Central Ohio, including the following counties, Delaware, Franklin OH and Licking. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 AM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Newark, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Delaware, Gahanna, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Johnstown, Sunbury, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Utica, Ashley, Hanover, Granville South, Beechwood Trails, Summit Station and Fairfield Beach.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
